summary: This document is an email chain from August 2019 among law enforcement personnel coordinating logistics for the planned search of Jeffrey Epstein's Little St. James Island. It details planning for personnel, lodging, transportation, and equipment, and references coordination with the SDNY and previous searches.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The target of the investigation; the planned search is for his private island, Little St. James.

events.title: Planned search of Little St. James Island
events.description: Law enforcement personnel coordinate logistics (lodging, transport, personnel) for the execution of a search warrant on Jeffrey Epstein's private island.

events.title: Initial coordination for island search
events.description: Initial email discussing providing assistance for the planned search of Epstein's island, noting the goal to execute within 30 days.

events.title: SDNY drafting search affidavit
events.description: The SDNY advises they are drafting the affidavit for the search of Little St. James Island and aim to have it sworn out, likely on Thursday (Aug 8).

keyFacts: Law enforcement was actively planning a substantial search operation for Jeffrey Epstein's Little St. James Island in early August 2019.
The search planning involved coordination between multiple agencies including the FBI's New York Field Office, SDNY, CBP, and USCG.
Logistical challenges included limited hotel availability on St. Thomas due to a prior hurricane and the need to transport personnel, equipment, and water to the island.
The warrant for Epstein's NYC residence resulted in 845 pictures taken over 13 hours, setting a precedent for the planned island search.
The SDNY preferred to isolate the 2019 case from the investigation into Epstein that occurred approximately 12 years prior.
